description:
18xx in 90 minutes? Yes!

18Xpress delivers the feel of a middle-weight 18xx game in just 90 minutes.

18Xpress features a streamlined network building and income system that significantly reduces the playing time of a typical 18xx game without sacrificing the core aspects of the system. This luckless game was inspired by the simplicity of Railways of England and Wales, 1889, and the Historic Railroads System by Winsome Games.

A special thanks goes out to Isaac Bickerstaff for generously providing the name of the game during the Print & Play Dice Game Contest.

In this chess variant, every time you capture an enemy piece, you may take any one of your captured pieces and put it into your reserve. On your turn, instead of moving, you may take any piece from your reserve and put it on any 
empty space on the board, except one that would result in a checkmate. When your pawns reach your opponent's back row, instead of promoting them, you may put them into your reserve.

This is 4 games in 1 box, all relating to 36 famous artists and their artworks which hang in the White House.

The four games which can be played with the two sets of 36 tiles with images from he paintings are:

Memory: 2 or more players; using 72 cards and standard rules.

Go Collecting: 4 or more players; a memory and recognition game where the winner ends up holding the most numbers of pairs which are earned by hand management and visual identification.

Name The Painting: 2 or more players; a flashcards-type game where one player holds up the 36 cards one at a time, and the players are expected to identify the artist and title of the work. The winner is the player with the most cards at game end.

Bingo: 2 to 4 players; using cards and the master sheet with detailed info about the paintings (each column has a number 1-4) and a die. The die is rolled to determine which columns belong to which players, and players take turn trying to pick a random card from one of 6 stacks of 12 and matching it with a painting in that column. If there is a match, the player places the tile in that column atop the painting face down. If the drawn tile is not a match, it is returned to the bottom of the same stack. The winner is the first to complete his or her column.

Magma is a game for two to six players. Your goal is to claim as much territory as possible while using as few pieces as possible. If you’re playing with more than three players, you’re playing on a two-player team. (How do you get two-player teams with five players? One player controls two home bases.)  Play is a lot like a fusion of Chinese Checkers and Go, except you can only jump pieces of your own color.

Magma uses a custom board and a bunch of tokens in three different colors.

The rules and board are available at: http://www.invisible-city.com/play/527/. If you don’t want to assemble your own set, or if you want a nicer-looking board, you can order a copy from The Game Crafter for a very reasonable price: http://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/magma

Magma has fairly simple rules. Thanks to CPSIA, the game is appropriate for ages 12 and up (although parental supervision could probably reduce this restriction significantly). A 6-player game takes about 45 minutes to play.

This a noncollectible card game designed and printed by a joined effort of friends from all around Poland. We used to meet for a week or so under the ruins of a castle Ogrodzieniec, Poland.

The game uses the characters and pictures of actual persons from this group and requires several k10 dice and any suitable counters to play.

The goal for each player is to gain 20 victory points (originally called 'morale') over 4 location cards, which represent various actual locations around the castle and our tent camp.

One of the unique features of the game is that if player plays a card representing him/herself he/she gains special abilities.

The full deck consists of around 60 cards and can also be used to play standard card games.

Based in a populat spanish TV Quiz of the 80'. The players have a polluted landscape formed by twelve cards. The objetive of the game is turn on all the cards to convert the polluted landscape in a beautiful and wonderful nature landscape.
To do this tha player must answer questions about nature, environment, science...


Basado en un popular concurso español de los 80. Los jugadores tienen un paisaje contaminado formado por 12 cartas. El objetivo del juego es dar la vuelta a todas las cartas convirtiendo el paisaje contaminado en un bonito y maravilloso paisaje natural.
Para hacerlo los jugadores deberan responder preguntas sobre naturaleza, medio ambiente y ciencias...

Ecstasy is a game for lovers who have forgotten the excitement of their mate. The path around the board is meant to get bring partners closer together both emotionally and physically.

Each player must pass the Preparation space and write down exactly what they want done. The game is completed when one player crosses the finish line. The winner must then have what they wrote down for the preparation space completed.

Mehinaku is a game for 2-6 players that simulates the growth of an ancient indigenous tribe in Brazil. Each player needs to cooperate with the others to develop the village and grow the population while pleasing the deities. But be careful! The High Xingu has real and supernatural dangers to avoid if you wish to successfully grow your tribe's village.

A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Another entry into the realm of Monopoly, the Scooby-Doo Collectors edition.

"Klau Mau" is a variety of the classic card game "Mau Mau". In "Klau Mau" you are playing a thief trying to get the most valuable cards. Upgraded with some special cards you have to try to get the most points and win the game this way. Aside from the influences of "Mau Mau", "Klau Mau" got some game mechanics from the popular "Uno".

With "Klau Mau" Nürnberger Spielkarten Verlag GmbH put a newly card game onto the market, which combines two good knewn card games to create a new gaming experience.

The game is made for two up to eight players and suitable for players of age seven. One round runs about 20 minutes.

"Merry-Go-Sound is a game that facilitates articulation practice on a variety of levels (word, phrase, and sentence) in an enjoyable way."

This is an educational speech therapy game.

Players move around the board while drawing cards which require them to repeat a word, phrase, or sentence at the target level desired by the therapist. The first player to successful articulate these sounds and reach the merry-go-round wins.

Designed for children ages 5 to 10 years old.

Includes a colorful board, cards, 6 plastic tokens, and a spinner.

What's Your Problem is a childrens' game about problem solving. Players move along a path through different areas on the board such as Sad Street, Frustrated Forest, and Surprise City with the ultimate goal of reaching Happy House. Players draw cards with an illustration of a problematic situation such as having to eat food you don't like or feeling ignored. Players then describe a possible solution (there are no wrong answers) and move the number of spaces indicated on the card. There are also special spaces on the board which feature an emoticon-style face which require the player to describe the emotion represented by the face to earn an extra turn.

A card game where players to have the fewest parasite at the end of The Game.
Players are dealt four cards of different cats. At each turn, move one card of the player to the left will until someone takes all four cards of the same cat.
Then they should quickly extend your hand in the center of the table and the last to do so will get a letter from the parasite.

From publishers web site:

Nature Dome is an easy-to-learn, beautifully illustrated dueling card game that includes 50 animal Power Cards, 5 Attack Boost cards and countless hours of fun for players of all ages.

Take turns attacking, defending and escaping as you score hits and diminish your opponent's Health Points. The first player to knock their opponent out wins the round!

It's a fun, family-friendly way to encourage imagination, reinforce addition and subtraction skills, develop strategic thinking and learn about animals from the everyday to the very weird and from all corners of the world.

Each Nature Dome deck is complete and ready to play out of the box; or combine it with your other Nature Dome decks for more dynamic play than ever before.

From Box:
Step into Nature Dome

Where gifted individuals are united and trained to become master warriors who wield weapons as old as the world.

The weapons are nature's fury itself: tooth and claw, hide and bone, limb and tail. Summoned by magic and scaled to your human size, they are yours to control. Because you are among the chosen few to enter... NATURE DOME.

Each player takes on the role as a Coronation Street character.  Each player must visit 5 locations and collect object cards and rescue one of Jack's pigeons.  The first player to collect all 5 object cards and a pigeon, and return to their starting place and answer a Coronation Street trivia question is the winner.

In Call It A Day!, a player is chosen to be storyteller, and begins by drawing one of over 200 Alias cards. The Alias card reveals the character for that round. The character might be a teacher or time traveler, mermaid or movie star, vet or vampire—or one of hundreds of other familiar and fantastical possibilities.

Now it's time to see what might happen in the character’s story. Draw eight of the more than 700 Call It A Day! Activity cards. The storyteller’s job is to tell a story that includes at least six of the eight Activities drawn. The storyteller now weaves a story, arranging the cards in whatever order helps tell the best story.

After the story has been told, the other players rate it from zero to five. The storyteller function then passes to the next player, with each storyteller drawing new Aliases and Activites and telling stories for a predetermined number of rounds. The player with the highest score wins.

From box cover:
You will only be able to defeat the criminal minds which have conceived the greatest conspiracy of all times only if you are worthy of James Bond. But to be successful, you must prove you have the distinctive qualities of the legendary "007" secret agent!
Further to the special James Bond dice, the game also includes 110 illustraded cards with pictures taken from famous James Bond movies.
A real collection for all fans of the adventures Her Majesty's sevret agent has been through!

Contents:
110 special cards
3 special dice
150 punched cardboard tokens
6 plastic "Bond" markers
1 standard plastic marker
1 game board
1 set of rule

Another entry in Kosmos' "Mitbringspiel" line, this is a smaller, easier, quicker version of the full-sized original game, Der Dativ ist dem Genitiv sein Tod.

The game includes 80 double-sided cards and 24 tokens.

Players have to determine the proper, grammatical way to complete sentences in German from a multiple-choice array of answers.

This is a small, promotional item/expansion.

It consists of 26 normal game cards, and a 27th card with an abbreviated version of the normal rules.

This item can be played by itself as an introduction to or demo of the game, or mixed in with the cards from the base game.

4+ exists out of board with holes in which pins can be placed, pins in 2 colors for both players and bars with 4 holes in 2 colors to place over the pins. Your target is to place as many bars over different rows of 4 pins of your own color. This will earn you points. The player with the most points wins. The game goes on until all pins are placed in the board.

Ever wonder what it would be like to have King David defend Jerusalem from a horde of Babylonian Chariots? How about having Emperor Augustus lead massive Roman armies in an assault against the Assyrian Fortress of Assur?

Well...Bible Battles TCG brings the Old Testament to life with over 500 unique cards from 6 of the ancient nations. This original and exiting game offers great family fun, and also provides a unique educational tool to help childeren and adults alike to learn about the amazing people and relive the stories from thousands of years ago.

Kipp-Klapp is a nicely made balancing game made with quality wood construction.  The game contains a base that holds up a simple from.  Players suspend a round playing surface approximately 5 inches in diameter.  Then players take turns placing the cylinders of different size and color on the circular surface trying to maintain balance.  Players are not allowed to touch the surface at any time.  The player who tips the pieces off the surface loses!

Components include:

base
frame
suspended circular playing surface
42 cylindrical playing pieces in 6 different colors and sizes/weights 
One 6 sided die with a different color on each face
One standard 6 sided die

The game includes four rule set alternatives:

1. Players throw the color die and place a corresponding piece on their turn.

2. Players separate out the cylinders equally between them.  Then on their turn, they throw only the numbered die and place that many cylinders.  Any cylinders that fall off the surface are added to that players collection.  The first player to run out of pieces wins!

3. Players throw both dice and must place the number of pieces of that color.

4. Players use only the color die.  The color of each cylinder corresponds to a point total.  The points are proportional to the sizes, so six white pieces are the same height as one blue, for example.  On a players turn they throw the color die and can place any equivalent size of pieces on the surface.

The children are shown a picture of a traffic sign. The child who can find the sign on his board wins the card. The first player to fill his board is the winner. Later you can play the game so that you show the children a card and they tell you which traffic sign is on it.

Smart7 is a set of entertaining and handy sized trivia games for the whole family. Each game contains 700 questions and answers, which are based on fun and exciting themes. The idea of these games is to collect 7 chips by answering correctly to 7 questions. The more you know, the faster you will be on your way to winning!
350 questions & answers and simple rules. The questions are about the wonderful world of the animals. The one who get more right answers - wins!
350 questions & answers and simple rules. The questions are about characters, creatures and events from the world of fairytales. Get more right for the end, and you've won!

350 questions & answers and simple rules. The questions are about distant countries, popular travel destinations and Finland. As like with all games in this series, the one who has most right answers by the end, is the winner!

Create and manage your own successful farm with the John Deere Family Farm Board Game.  You’ll decide which crops to plant, which equipment to invest in, how much fuel to buy, how to seed/harvest your land and when to buy more land.  Flood, insects, equipment, subsidies and much more will play a role as you make decisions that will determine the ultimate success of the farm.  The player with the most assets at the end of the game is the winner.  Includes large quad-fold game board, 24 land parcels, 6 hat pawns, 6 tractor pawns, 1 silo pawn, card, play money and instructions.

Race to build your ham and cheese sandwiches in this good-enough-to-eat game.  Be the first player to build three sandwiches in the correct order and you win the game.  But watch out!  An opponent with an Nono card can steal part of your sandwich, while the fly can ruin the whole lunch!  No reading required.  Includes 54 cards, plastic fly and instructions.

Game puts a new, High School Musical-themed spin on classic game of Twister

Features 4 songs and 4 dance sequences from "High School Musical"

Kids can dance along to the beat with favorite High School Musical characters

Comes with 2 CDs filled with "High School Musical" music

Recommended for ages 8 and up

Based on the smash Disney hit, "High School Musical," this game from Hasbro puts a new spin on the classic game of Twister. It features four songs and four dance sequences from "High School Musical," and kids can dance to the beat with their favorite High School Musical characters. Recommended for ages 8 and up, it is perfect for both fans of the movie and fans of dancing in general.

The smell of peanuts. The freshly-cut grass. The loud crack of the bat. (All sold separately.)

PDSN Diceman Baseball is a brand new, physical game from the previously-digital/theoretical minds at Pacdude Games. Simulate America's Pastime with a bunch of dice and cards. Including 52 player cards and 30 special Power Cards to swing the game for the home or away team. Each card is personalized with player bios and those fantastic PDSN graphics for a sleek, fun game.

Wondering what we're simulating in this game? Well, we have strikes, balls and outs, home runs, base hits, sacrifice bunts, suicide squeezes and more. It acts like baseball, it plays like baseball, just without all that pesky "running" and "sweating."

Great for 2 players, with minimal table space needed. Play it in a bar, play it at the game (if the game isn't too exciting), or play it anywhere you like. It's the fun of baseball, all in a tiny box.

A game of logic for 2 players where you must guess your opponent's secret numerical code. A deduction game where the codebreaker takes turns making a limited number of guesses, using logic to deduce the codemaker's secret code.

A New World is a multi-player, card-driven, area-control game, where players assume the lead of a major European nation during the XVI-XVIII centuries. Players will have to manage economy, policy, diplomacy, trade, world wide exploration, colonization,  religion, warfare in the effort to achieve supremacy. A New World offers an accurate and detailed historical context, supported by more 220 game-cards: players will have to deal with historical events performing to achieve better result than the historical nations did. Europe, Mediterranean Africa and Middle Eastern Asia figure out in the game map. World wide explorations and colonizations are managed by a set of dedicated game cards. Tons of political and military leaders have been added to the game by unique game counters. The victory tracking system of the game has been built to grant an open-end of scenarios by opponent hidden factors and bonuses to be claimed at the conclusion of the campaign game.

The former German territory, transformed into a wasteland by the nuclear holocaust that ended the Second World War in 1946, is the hostile setting of a new conflict between old enemies clenched in a struggle for the future of mankind.

Surviving Nazi leaders and Wehrmacht forces resurface in 1978 from underground shelters to rebuild an empire from the ashes of the world. Oblivious of the climatic, technological and political changes inflicted by more than 20 years of nuclear winter, they are about to face the mysterious Black Hand - elusive, abhorrent  masters of the wastes, and the combined might of the modern, highly mechanized and versatile NATO alliance.

Nuklear Winter 78 was a free print & play, tactical, platoon level simulation. The 15 campaign-linkable scenarios for 1-3 players depict the triumvirate struggle for power around Wewelsburg in the former central Germany, now a barren wasteland known as the Zone. The game contains:

     one rulebook (24 pages)
     one playbook (20 pages)
     one single sided map
     two countersheets (280 counters)
     three player aids


 
 


    
         News 2/3/2010

    
    
         Nuklear Winter is no longer a Print & Play game as it is in re-development to be produced as a game for Lock 'n Load Publishing, LLC. under the title Nuklear Winter '68

    



Re-implemented as Nuklear Winter '68.

Sherlock Deluxe

The Card Game Where Memory and Deduction are “Elementary”!

Winner of over 6 awards, including the Parent's Choice Gold award, The National Parenting Center's Seal of Approval, Creative Child Magazine's Preferred Choice Award and more, the Sherlock card game now has a new look in the Sherlock Deluxe edition!

The new and elegant book-shaped box attractively houses the popular game, and as a special addition, includes an intricately sculpted Sherlock pawn and 11 extra clue cards!

As Sherlock goes around and searches the clues, every player tries to remember each of the eight objects hidden in a facedown circle of cards.  Then, Sherlock travels from one card to another.  Each time Sherlock stops at a facedown card, the player has to remember which object is on that card.  Sherlock continues to move, as long as the player guesses correctly.

If Sherlock travels to a face-up card, then the player gets to keep that card. The first player to collect six cards wins!

*
      For 2 to 5 Players
    *
      Ages 5 to Adult
    *
      15 Minute Playing Time

Contents:  60 Clue Cards, 1 Sherlock Pawn and Instructions in English, Spanish & French

Re-implements:

    Sherlock

America's favorite quiz show meets ESPN in this handsome, take-anywhere edition. Use your clicker to get control of a question in categories such as: ESPN players You Love To Hate, Ballparks & Arenas, ESPN Personalities, NFL Brothers, NBA Head Coaches and dozen more. Collect chips for each correct answer as you make you way to FINAL JEOPARDY!

From Box Back:  18 holes of golf with nine holes on the front and nine holes on the back.

The Golf Game gives you everything you could ask for in a round of golf. Longest drive, iron shots, pitching, putting water hazards, out of bounds, sandtraps, and much more.

This game is as close to real golf as you can get without ever leaving your home.

Challenge Cards: With 3 levels of play: Junior, Amateur, and Professional.  All questions are golf related to help you eliminate penalties, teach you all about the game of golf, and challenge those who know everything about the game.

Also Included are: Score Cards (to register all the strokes of each player), Easy to follow instructions (to give you all the help you need to play the game), The Golf Club Spinner (used for your drive, iron, pitching, and putting... even that hole-in-one you have been looking for).

Options: Skins game, Point system, and Best ball are alternate ways to play the game.

The game for gay men that takes you and your partner through a dizzying array of sensuous thrills.

Picture cards guide you through a series of sexy trials. But be careful! No matter how excited you get you have to keep your passions in check. Otherwise you lose the game!

You'll find that finishing the game is a feat in itself. So take a deep breath, keep your cool, and let Exxxtasy add a little spice to your evenings... Enjoy the game!

includes:
1 board
4 decks of cards
1 die
1 hourglass
2 tokens

The game for couples who love oral sex! Orally tantalize your lover as you move your lube-filled game markers around the board. Reach the tongue first and your reward is Oral Sex! 
 The game includes:

* 11 in. x 7 in. game board
    * Die
    * 2 flavored lube game markers (each holds .25 fl. oz. of lube)
    * Easy-to-follow game rules

The game for gay women that takes you and your partner through a dizzying array of sensuous thrills.

Picture cards guide you through a series of sexy trials. But be careful! No matter how excited you get you have to keep your passions in check. Otherwise you lose the game!

You'll find that finishing the game is a feat in itself. So take a deep breath, keep your cool, and let Exxxtasy Female add a little spice to your evenings... Enjoy the game!
Be the first to reach the end and make your wish that the loser will have to make true!

includes:
1 board
4 decks of cards
1 die
1 hourglass
2 tokens

Players take turns answering erotic trivia questions, performing seductions based on instructions written on selected cards. The game includes the game board, game markers, a die, Secret Sealed Seductions cards, a notepad and pencil as well as two erotic trivia books. The game is based on Laura Corn's New York Times bestselling book of the same name. Winner will be the one who will get more right answers and more successful commands!

To play, roll the die, move your playing piece, and follow the instructions on the board where you land. For example, you may be told to read aloud an I've Never Card, which might say something like, "I've never had a lemonade stand" or "I've never had a pet goldfish." You then have to admit whether the statement is true or false, for which there are further exciting or funny consequences, depending on your answer. you may have to dance, sing, imitate your best friend, spin 5 times in a circle, and answer outrageous "I've Never...®" questions. Family friendly.

WAR HAS BEEN DECLARED! Build your Basecamp... Assemble your troops... Devastate the OPPOSING FORCE!!!

OpFor: Opposing Force™ is a customizable strategic card game in which you take command of a modern military force.

Build your basecamp consisting of Barracks - you'll need these to deploy your Personnel to the Battlefield 
Send in your Infantry and go head to head with your enemy 
Use your Medics save your defeated soldiers from being removed from the Battlefield  
Demoralize enemy forces by sending your Snipers to the Battlefield. 
Dish out orders to your troops by using the Special Action cards to perform tactical maneuvers on your enemy, giving you the edge you need to succeed in combat
Earn rewards by completing Special Missions
It's total chaos on the Battlefield as you struggle to keep the Opposing Force at bay while ensuring the survival of your General.

Wipe out the enemy forces or kill the General to claim your victory!

The Boot Camp Boxed Edition is a starter set that includes 2 forty-five card preconstructed Skirmish Decks representing 2 Platoons. Each Platoon consists of 1 General, 12 Soldiers, 3 Medics, 1 Sniper, 15 Barracks, 10 Special Action cards and 3 Special Mission cards.

BUILD A FORCE TO BE RECKONED WITH!!! COMING SOON: OpFor: Opposing Force™ expansion packs that allow you to build a more deadly fighting force:

Supply Dumps and Motor Pools to add to your Basecamp
Weapons and Equipment for your soldiers in battle
Mechanized Infantry: powerful soldiers to add to your growing force
Battle Tanks and Field Artillery to bombard your enemy's Basecamp
Anti-tank Vehicles to get rid of those pesky enemy Tanks
Navy SEALs for those sneaky missions behind enemy lines
All new Special Action and Mission Cards
New Generals with new Special Abilities

COMING THIS FALL:

OpFor: Opposing Force™: Metal Monsters - a stand alone armored vehicle combat card game
OpFor: Opposing Force™: Flyboys - a stand alone aerial combat card game
OpFor: Opposing Force™: Deep 6  - a stand alone naval combat card game


        A portion of the procedes from the sale of OPFOR will be donated to Operation Homefront, a charity that lends help and support to the families of our service men and women. If you want to get involved, go to operationhomefront.net

“Little Insurgents: Warsaw 1944” is a eurogame about scouts delivering orders during the Warsaw Rising in Poland in 1944, when the people of Warsaw rose against the Nazis occupying their city. Young boys worked as a couriers delivering letters and orders between squads of rebels, running through the underground sewage canals of Warsaw. Many of them died on that duty.

In “Little Insurgents” each player takes command of a unit of three Scouts with the goal of delivering the most orders on time. The scouts from different units are racing against each other to be first, but they also have to co-operate. If the order is not delivered on time crucial parts of the city, or even whole districts can be lost to the occupiers. If too many orders fall into hands of the enemy all players lose.

The game comes with two variants of rules: basic and extended, with basic being easier and involving more random elements. It is suitable for young players and families. The extended variant, dedicated to adults and gamers, involves special actions, more planning and secret goals.

The game will be published by Egmont Polska in the autumn of 2009 with rules in three languages: Polish, English and German.

The game was developed in cooperation with Polish Scout Association (ZHP) and the Warsaw Rising Museum.

Exciting game for the youngest of family! Who is afraid of the big bad wolf? This game is a little adventure towards safe stone house, which rescued them from danger. The game can be played with 2-4 players who each receive pork. Piglets built straw house, stick house and finally the stone house, in that order. But the task is not easy. Hungry and always on guard Big Bad Wolf waits impatiently for the moment when it could blow down the houses of the piglets. You win the game if you reach the stone house without the wolf catching you!

Birthday party game is a delicious birthday cake. Your job is to chip yourself a juicy piece of cake by dice throwing. The question, however, is not just a normal piece of cake, because you'll need to assemble the layer-layer plate candles always bottom up. Cuts to be taken whenever the dice seems to shift to a picture of the piece. The task is challenging more than you think - dice is a tyrant! Winner is the one who gets more pieces.

Daft cat stalks the table to return to have a taste for themselves. Can you find the goodies before the other players? In this fun memory game, players try to find a table of dishes. Around the table is a different color chairs and if you have the right colored chair cards, you will check out the cups and see what the game board is hiding. When you find a plate to your own dishes, you're one step closer to a winning! A good memory is needed, because the board changes place all the time. In addition, the cat is complicated by a pattern by moving to another chair and deceive you as to forget to use your own memory! Winner is the one who gets more dishes with food!

An exciting adventure! Dinosaur game for the little ones in the family. Four different dinosaur adventure in the dinosaur land visiting dense jungle, volcanic root and dry desert. The player should make an effort in this game and retrieve the cards. The player who first find all the four cards and get the home in its cave, it is a game winner.

Part of The Land Before Time series of dinosaur-themed games for kids.

Collect cool animal pictures, which consist of three pieces. Get points for each completed picture of your animal. The game contains 15 different types of colorful animal images and a game you can play three different ways. You'll also get a wonderful booklet that allows you to add information to the game animals.

FAMILY ALIAS is a fun word and picture explanation of a game where you must be able to say otherwise, that is to play the partner to say as many as possible in the desired word by giving him the quick tips. FAMILY ALIAS is played with at least two teams, the upper limit of players is not made. Family Alias words and pictures are sound familiar, but how to explain the ordinary word 'CHAIR'?  It sitting. It is not necessarily sufficient, guesser may propose a sofas. The game is a fast rhythmical, as an hourglass of sand drains mercilessly ... Finland's most popular game now made family version! All ages of family members can play the game like grandparents of children of children. The game can also play-up the players with each other. Well, how is it? Are the kids parents clever? It shows when you spend a common, a merry-minute game and play FAMILY aliases!

Based on Alias.
